Body: You cannot talk about semantics without pragmatics and vice versa but a decent way to cut the cake is a broadly relevance-theoretic view. Semantics is the stable aspects of encoded meaning which are always triggered sand make a predictable contribution to the final interpretation (however minimal that encoded stuff might be). Pragmatics is the inferred and non- encoded and non-predictable aspects of meaning. Look at 'thoughts and utterances' by robyn carston for a good discussion of all this.
